docs.snippet: The Mexican Constitution of 1917 promised a redistribution of the country's rich farmlands, which had been worked but never owned by centuries of peons. For the past two decades Mexican Governments have been confiscating large estates, expropriating...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mexican Constitution of 1917 promised a redistribution of the country's rich farmlands, which had been worked but never owned by centuries of peons. For the past two decades Mexican Governments have been confiscating large estates, expropriating foreign-owned lands and turning these over to more than 1,200,000 rural families.

headline.main: ABROAD; Mexican Land On Manchukuo's Border Tension Eased Peace in the Chaco
